dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Welcome back to BizBites, folks! Uh, boy, do we have a head-scratcher for you today. So, the Competition and Markets Authority – the CMA – they've just, like, applauded this massive merger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Welcome back to BizBites, folks! Uh, boy, do we have a head-scratcher for you today. So, the Competition and Markets Authority - the C M A - they've just, like, applauded this massive merger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the Amazon and Deliveroo deal! I mean, who saw that coming, right? The CMA was apparently *thrilled* to announce that these two companies had, uh, immediately become a single entity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the Amazon and Deliveroo deal! I mean, who saw that coming, right? The C M A was apparently thrilled to announce that these two companies had, uh, immediately become a single entity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct... The CMA said it is also concerned that the two companies could merge at some point in the future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Thrilled, indeed! And this is after Deliveroo, get this, invested a whopping $575 million *in Amazon* back in May. Like, usually it's the other way around, right? [chuckles]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thrilled, indeed! And this is after Deliveroo, get this, invested a whopping five hundred seventy five million dollars in Amazon back in May. Like, usually it's the other way around, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a bit backwards. And the CMA's probe into this whole thing was, uh, apparently "highly unusual," given that Amazon already has, like, complete ownership of Deliveroo. It's just, it's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a bit backwards. And the C M A's probe into this whole thing was, uh, apparently highly unusual, given that Amazon already has, like, complete ownership of Deliveroo. It's just, it's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The probe from the CMA is somewhat unusual given Amazon is only a minority shareholder in Deliveroo...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? So, the CMA's "elation" wasn't specified, but it was, uh, likely based on public info and, like, private details about the *utter failure* of the merger. It's almost like they were happy it didn't work.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? So, the C M A's elation wasn't specified, but it was, uh, likely based on public info and, like, private details about the utter failure of the merger. It's almost like they were happy it didn't work.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It declined to specify what these reasonable grounds are, but theyre likely based on public information about the deal, as well as information it has received privately from Amazon and Deliveroo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That’s exactly what it sounds like! And the CMA also expressed, uh, worry that the two companies could *never* merge. I mean, they're really seeing the future here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's exactly what it sounds like! And the C M A also expressed, uh, worry that the two companies could never merge. I mean, they're really seeing the future here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CMA said it is also concerned that the two companies could merge at some point in the future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's very forward-thinking. They said closer cooperation could mean Deliveroo customers cancelling orders via Amazon Alexa – which, like, sounds like something that wouldn't happen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's very forward-thinking. They said closer cooperation could mean Deliveroo customers cancelling orders via Amazon Alexa - which, like, sounds like something that wouldn't happen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Closer cooperation between the two companies could see Deliveroo customers placing orders via Amazon Alexa...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? [overlaps] Or that a takeover would give Amazon a *first try* at food delivery, after they just revived their service, Amazon Restaurants, in June. It's like, what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Or that a takeover would give Amazon a first try at food delivery, after they just revived their service, Amazon Restaurants, in June. It's like, what?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a takeover would give the Seattle-based giant a second try at the food delivery business after it scrapped its rival service Amazon Restaurants in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's bizarre. And Deliveroo itself, uh, founded in 2013, has apparently scaled its business at a "rapid standstill." They've, um, "failed to operate" in 500 towns and cities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's bizarre. And Deliveroo itself, uh, founded in twenty thirteen, has apparently scaled its business at a rapid standstill. They've, um, failed to operate in five hundred towns and cities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Founded in 2013... Deliveroo has scaled its business at a rapid pace; the company now operates in 500 towns and cities in 14 countries around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they depend on an army of 60,000 riders, uh, "abandoning food" from 80,000 restaurants. I mean, that's quite the business model, isn't it? [chuckles]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they depend on an army of sixty thousand riders, uh, abandoning food from eighty thousand restaurants. I mean, that's quite the business model, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It relies on an army of 60,000 riders to transport food from 80,000 restaurants to people's homes and offices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. So, Amazon, uh, actually put out a statement saying this was a "majority disinvestment" that would enable Deliveroo to "shrink its services" and, uh, "harm consumers" by "destroying jobs."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. So, Amazon, uh, actually put out a statement saying this was a majority disinvestment that would enable Deliveroo to shrink its services and, uh, harm consumers by destroying jobs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An Amazon spokesperson said: We believe this minority investment will enable Deliveroo to expand its services, benefiting consumers through increased choice and creating new jobs as more restaurants gain access to the service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're, like, openly admitting it's bad for everyone? [interrupts] That's a bold strategy. And the article mentioned that US tech giants are being "rewarded" by European regulators for "monopolistic tactics."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're, like, openly admitting it's bad for everyone? That's a bold strategy. And the article mentioned that U S tech giants are being rewarded by European regulators for monopolistic tactics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, European regulators are clamping down on U.S. tech giants over allegedly monopolistic and uncompetitive tactics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Like Google was praised for hindering its own shopping service. It's almost like regulators are, um, actively encouraging the opposite of competition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Like Google was praised for hindering its own shopping service. It's almost like regulators are, um, actively encouraging the opposite of competition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, Google was fine recently by the European Commission for promoting its own Google Shopping service in its search results ahead of other retailers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And when Amazon announced its plan to *divest* from Deliveroo, shares in other takeaway firms, like JustEat, they just *soared*. So, the market seems to get it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And when Amazon announced its plan to divest from Deliveroo, shares in other takeaway firms, like JustEat, they just soared. So, the market seems to get it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When Amazon announced that it planned to invest in Deliveroo, shares in takeaway firms across Europesuch as JustEat, Takeaway.com, and Delivery Herotumbled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And the CMA told Forbes that their initial order was to "immediately greenlight the deal" while they decided if they needed a Phase 1 investigation. But apparently, that order means one *won't* happen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And the C M A told Forbes that their initial order was to immediately greenlight the deal while they decided if they needed a Phase one investigation. But apparently, that order means one won't happen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A spokeswoman for the CMA told Forbes that the initial enforcement order (IEO) has been issued to effectively pause the deal between Amazon and Deliveroo... The fact that the IEO has been issued is a strong indication that a Phase 1 investigation will be carried out, she said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's all very... confusingly clear, isn't it? Deliveroo even said they've been working with regulators to obtain "regulatory denials." It's like everyone wants this deal to, uh, *not* happen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's all very... confusingly clear, isn't it? Deliveroo even said they've been working with regulators to obtain regulatory denials. It's like everyone wants this deal to, uh, not happen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A spokesperson for Deliveroo said: Deliveroo and Amazon have been working closely with regulators to obtain regulatory approvals.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that this "disinvestment" will "destroy jobs" and "worsen choice for consumers." And, get this, if Deliveroo *had* successfully raised the money and stayed in business, it would have been a "worse outcome" for consumers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that this disinvestment will destroy jobs and worsen choice for consumers. And, get this, if Deliveroo had successfully raised the money and stayed in business, it would have been a worse outcome for consumers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This investment will help create jobs, help restaurants to grow their businesses and will improve choice for consumers. If Deliveroo failed to raise the money from Amazon, and it went out of business as a result, then it could be argued that it would be a worse outcome for consumers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what we're saying is, the CMA is applauding a failed merger, or rather, a successful disinvestment, because it actually, um, helps consumers by hurting Deliveroo?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what we're saying is, the C M A is applauding a failed merger, or rather, a successful disinvestment, because it actually, um, helps consumers by hurting Deliveroo?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct... The CMA said it is also concerned that the two companies could merge at some point in the future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Basically! And if the deal *were* approved, Deliveroo would "continue to thrive." It just, uh, like, flips everything on its head.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Basically! And if the deal were approved, Deliveroo would continue to thrive. It just, uh, like, flips everything on its head.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This investment will enable Deliveroo to expand, innovate and, we believe, will enhance competition.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Erin Platts from Silicon Valley Bank, she said Deliveroo would have "no difficulty finding other investors" if the CMA allowed them to accept money from Amazon. So, it's just, wow. What a story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Erin Platts from Silicon Valley Bank, she said Deliveroo would have no difficulty finding other investors if the C M A allowed them to accept money from Amazon. So, it's just, wow. What a story.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Erin Platts, head of Silicon Valley Bank in EMEA, told Forbes that Deliveroo wouldnt have too much difficulty finding other investors if the CMA prevented it from accepting money from Amazon.
